channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Landmark climate change case will open at the top U.N. court
item.description: The U.N.'s top court begins hearings Monday on the legal obligation of countries to fight climate change.
item.content:encoded: The U.N.'s top court begins hearings Monday on the legal obligation of countries to fight climate change.
item.dc:creator: Kristina Kukolja

item.title: Crash prevention technology shows 'huge potential,' but the roadmap is up for debate
item.description: Nearly all new cars now come with automatic emergency braking and other safety features. Researchers say these systems are saving lives, but there's still debate about how to make them better.
item.content:encoded:
Nearly all new cars now come with automatic emergency braking and other safety features. Researchers say these systems are saving lives, but there's still debate about how to make them better.

(Image credit: Dan Purdy)
item.dc:creator: Joel Rose

item.title: As federal aid shrinks, communities try new ways to tackle child poverty on their own
item.description: After Congress ended extra cash aid for families, local efforts aimed to fill the gap. In Flint, Michigan, Rx Kids gives cash aid to every family for a baby's first year. Will it work elsewhere?
item.content:encoded:
After Congress ended extra cash aid for families, local efforts aimed to fill the gap. In Flint, Michigan, Rx Kids gives cash aid to every family for a baby's first year. Will it work elsewhere?

(Image credit: ‎‎Kate Wells)
item.dc:creator: Kate Wells

item.title: Who are the rebels who have seized control of Aleppo, Syria?
item.description: Syrian rebels have swept through parts of the country at lightning pace, taking control of the the second-largest city, Aleppo. But who are they and what are their aims?
item.content:encoded:
Syrian rebels have swept through parts of the country at lightning pace, taking control of the the second-largest city, Aleppo. But who are they and what are their aims?

(Image credit: Omar Haj Kadour)
item.dc:creator: Willem Marx

item.title: FDA battles vaping industry at the Supreme Court
item.description: The justices will hear arguments about the FDA's rejection of some e-cigarettes. High schoolers are at the center of the case.
item.content:encoded:
The justices will hear arguments about the FDA's rejection of some e-cigarettes. High schoolers are at the center of the case.

(Image credit: Scott Olson/Getty Images)
item.dc:creator: Nina Totenberg

item.title: Dizzy after one drink? Social drinkers on obesity drugs lose the taste for alcohol
item.description: A new study finds people who take weight-loss drugs also cut back on alcohol consumption. Researchers think the drugs could be a promising new treatment for addiction.
item.content:encoded:
A new study finds people who take weight-loss drugs also cut back on alcohol consumption. Researchers think the drugs could be a promising new treatment for addiction.

(Image credit: AzmanJaka)
item.dc:creator: Allison Aubrey

item.title: A landmark climate change case will open at the top U.N. court
item.description: The hearings come after years of lobbying by island nations who fear they could simply disappear under rising sea waters,
item.content:encoded:
The hearings come after years of lobbying by island nations who fear they could simply disappear under rising sea waters,

(Image credit: Peter Dejong)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: Hong Kong launches panda sculpture tour as the city hopes the bear craze boosts tourism
item.description: Thousands of giant panda sculptures will greet residents and tourists starting Saturday in Hong Kong, where enthusiasm for the bears has grown since two cubs were born in a local theme park.
item.content:encoded:
Thousands of giant panda sculptures will greet residents and tourists starting Saturday in Hong Kong, where enthusiasm for the bears has grown since two cubs were born in a local theme park.

(Image credit: Chan Long Hei)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: The International Criminal Court is facing doubts as its member states meet
item.description: The court faces pushback over arrest warrants for Israeli officials, sexual harassment allegations against the court's chief prosecutor and a very empty docket.
item.content:encoded:
The court faces pushback over arrest warrants for Israeli officials, sexual harassment allegations against the court's chief prosecutor and a very empty docket.

(Image credit: Peter Dejong)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: Most Black Friday shoppers bagged their deals online this year, with record spending
item.description: As many opted to surf the web instead of face the crowds the day after Thanksgiving, shoppers spent a record $10.8 billion in online purchases. Cyber Monday is set to smash another spending record.
item.content:encoded:
As many opted to surf the web instead of face the crowds the day after Thanksgiving, shoppers spent a record $10.8 billion in online purchases. Cyber Monday is set to smash another spending record.

(Image credit: Gene J. Puskar)
item.dc:creator: Emma Bowman
